meanings.definition: To make something owned or controlled collectively by a group of people.
meanings.sent1: The community communised the park for everyone to enjoy.
meanings.sent2: The villagers communised the tools to share among themselves.
meanings.sent3: The neighborhood communised the library books for all to read.
meanings.sent4: The team communised their resources to achieve a common goal.
meanings.sent5: The family communised their savings for a big vacation.

meanings.definition: To establish a system of government in which the means of production are owned and controlled by the community as a whole.
meanings.sent1: The town communised the factories to benefit all residents.
meanings.sent2: The country communised the farms to ensure fair distribution.
meanings.sent3: The school communised the supplies to promote equality among students.
meanings.sent4: The organization communised its assets to support the local community.
meanings.sent5: The city communised the resources to improve living standards for everyone.
